F5 Distributed Cloud 212 - Advanced Client Side Defense¶

F5 Distributed Cloud’s SaaS Client Side Defense can help you mitigate application threats. During this lab you can use your own F5 Distributed Cloud account and your own application (origin server) that you are going to protect with CSD. Alternatively you can also use the F5 sales-demo application https://shop.sales-demo.f5demos.com where the required JavaScript tag for CSD has already been added.

Lab & Tasks:¶

The next page (Introduction) will cover the lab environment, access, and lab variables.

Labs:

  • 1. Introduction: Advanced Client Side Defense
    • 1.1. Prerequisites
    • 1.2. What we’ll learn
    • 1.3. Lab Environment
    • 1.4. F5 Distributed Cloud Client Side Defense: Prevent Skimming and Formjacking
    • 1.5. Client-Side Monitoring, Detection, and Mitigation
  • 2. Base Configuration of CSD
    • 2.1. Lab 1: Configure CSD and add the JavaScript tag to the web page
  • 3. Using the Client Side Defense Dashboard
    • 3.1. Lab 2: Mitigate suspicious or allow unsuspicious domains
    • 3.2. |1. Configure Logging
  • 4. Appendix A - Artificially generate suspicious domains
  • 5. Appendix B - Injection using local Overrides in Chrome
    • 5.1. Set up local Overrides in Chrome DevTools
  • 6. Conclusion
  • 7. Appendix
